data.event: In October 1854, Charles Matney settled in the area that was to become Richland, near the confluence of Camp Creek with the Wakarusa River.
In 1857 a post office was opened north of town and a schoolhouse was constructed, out of logs, on the northeast corner of Matney's land.
Richland also established a newspaper, Argosy, in 1893 and it included local news but also news about nearby communities including Twin Mound, Overbrook and Clinton.

event.title: summer of 1894, Laura Ingalls Wilder passed

data.event: In the summer of 1894, Laura Ingalls Wilder passed through Richland with her husband and daughter.
